text: Kim Il-sung Square is the national square of North Korea. It is in the capital Pyongyang next to the Taedong River. The square is used for military parades and performances for national holidays. Around the square are national institutions that include stairs with chairs overlooking the square. == Other websites == *Asian Historical Architecture: Kim Il-sung Square images *Traveller's blog with pictures from North Korea ; Several photos of Kim Il Sung Square. *Kim Il-sung Square, Pyongyang, North Korea (video) â€” practising for the Mass games Category:1954 establishments in Asia Category:Establishments in North Korea Category:National squares Category:Pyongyang Category:Town squares in Asia
title: Kim Il-sung Square
